courseDetails.title: The Concept of  Lean Waste
courseDetails.shortDescription: Reduce waste and streamline value flow
courseDetails.longDescription:
Companies are always looking for new ways to improve business efficiency and increase quality. To run a business at optimal capacity, you need to reduce or eliminate waste from processes and improve production flow. In this course, you'll learn about Lean strategies to reduce waste by determining which operations add value and which don't. You'll explore the concept of continuous flow, and discover how to balance work processes to make production flow more efficient. You'll define what waste is, where it exists, and what causes it. You'll also examine aspects of Muda, continuous flow, line balancing, value and non-value-add, and practical Lean techniques for improving Operations Management.

What is waste in Lean Manufacturing?

A core principle in lean methodology is the removal of waste within an operation. And in any business, one of the heaviest drains on profitability is waste. Lean waste can come in the form of time, material, and labor. But it may also be related to the utilization of skill-sets as well as poor planning. In lean manufacturing, waste is any expense or effort that is expended but which does not transform raw materials into an item the customer is willing to pay for. By optimizing process steps and eliminating waste, the only true value is added at each phase of production.

Today, the Lean Manufacturing model recognizes 8 types of waste within an operation; seven originally conceived when the Toyota Production System was first conceived, and an eighth added when the lean methodology was adopted within the Western World. Seven of the eight wastes are production process-oriented, while the eighth waste is directly related to management’s ability to utilize personnel.

WHAT YOU WILL LEARN to

  1. classify production activities as a value-add, non-value-add, or necessary non-value-add.

  2. identify strategies for eliminating waste caused by overproduction and inventory.

  3. identify strategies for eliminating motion, waiting, and transportation waste.

  4. identify elimination strategies for waste caused by overprocessing and defects

  5. match cycle time and takt time to their descriptions

  6. identify the final three steps for balancing a production line
targetAudiences: Any professional, who is seeking career growth in the quality management sector

Managers, Supervisors, Team Leaders, CEO, and Senior Managers, who want to encourage continuous improvement for an organisation and responsible for developing lean thinking, practical skills, measurement of production staff, and analysing the performance of the employee in the workplace.
Individuals involved in a continuous improvement project who needs a complete overview of the process

Using a sample file provided by QuickBooks, learners will navigate the software, identify commonly-used areas, and comprehend the relationship between data input and the resultant financial statements and related reports.

The course utilizes a transactional analysis approach, categorizing transactions into accounting cycles: vendor cycle (alternatively known as payment, purchases, accounts payable, or expenses cycle), customer cycle (also referred to as revenue, sales, or accounts receivable cycle), and employee cycle. Each cycle's data input forms and their impact on financial statements and related reports are examined in detail.

The subsequent section involves setting up a new company file, a crucial learning step to grasp foundational accounting system components like the chart of accounts, service items, revenue items, and starting balances. Learners will practice entering a variety of common transactions over two months, backed by instructional videos, and analyze each transaction's impact on the financial statements and related reports.

Bank reconciliations, an essential part of financial integrity, are also covered, demonstrating reconciliation procedures using sample bank statements. Further, an extensive section devoted to bank feeds ensures learners understand how to connect to the bank, download and incorporate bank data into the accounting system, and apply bank rules for efficiency.

Following this, we delve into adjusting entries, used to align financial statement reports to their accounting basis at the month or year-end. Key accounting bases such as accrual, cash, or tax basis will be explored.

The course additionally covers budget construction best practices, QuickBooks budget entry, and budget report generation. Specialized topics such as account number usage, form customization, class tracking, transaction memorization, and multiple currency handling are also included, providing a well-rounded understanding of QuickBooks Online.

By the conclusion of this course, learners will have developed a comprehensive understanding and skill set to expertly navigate and utilize QuickBooks Online for all their accounting needs.

courseDetails.title: Two QuickBooks File-Business & Personal vs One File For Both
courseDetails.shortDescription: Practice problem format comparing two methods to enter business and personal data in QuickBooks Desktop Pro 2019
courseDetails.longDescription:
QuickBooks Pro Desktop 2019, comparing two methods of tracking both business and personal records, one using two QuickBooks Desktop 2019 files, and one using a sing file to track both business and personal financial data using QuickBooks class tracking feature.

We will work with hands-on practical practice problems together under both methods, compare the results, and discuss the pros and cons of each approach.

The course will start with the method of using two separate QuickBooks files for business and personal records because this is the most widely recommended method and provides the greatest separation of business and personal data which is usually a good thing.

We will create new QuickBooks files for both business and personal records. The course will also provide backup files that can be used to jump forward in the course or to rework problems while using the same data set.

We will enter two months of data into our QuickBooks files using simulated bank statements we will provide in the course as PDF files. After we enter the data into QuickBooks, we will generate reports and compare the data in the personal and business files.

The next step will be to enter similar data into one QuickBooks file, a QuickBooks file that will be used to track both personal and business accounting data. To achieve this goal, we will start a new QuickBooks file and enter financial data from a simulated bank statement the course will provide in PDF format.

As we enter data into the joint QuickBooks file, we will assign a class to each transaction that will help to separate the data during financial reporting. After we have entered the data, we will generate reports including a profit and loss by class. The profit and loss by class report well separate business and personal expenses. We will also discuss other options for filtering reports by class.

We will then compare the two methods, the use of two separate QuickBooks files to the use of one QuickBooks file for both business and personal data, separating the content with the use of class tracking.

Next, we will discuss personal balance sheet items and how we can add them to our financial data including financial investments, our home, our mortgage, and our auto.

We will also discuss alternative methods for tracking credit cards, recording loan payments, and entering employee W-2 income.  

In addition to the instructional videos, this course will include downloadable  

•    QuickBooks Pro Desktop 2019 Backup files

•    Excel practice files

•    Downloadable PDF Files  

The QuickBooks Desktop 2019 backup files are a great tool that allows us to jump ahead in the material or to rework material if we choose.

Excel practice files will be preformatted and will generally have at least two tabs, one tab with the completed work and a second tab with a preformatted worksheet we can fill in as we watch the instructional videos.

Assessment Description:

A User Experience Design assessment is a crucial tool for evaluating the knowledge and skills of individuals in this field. It consists of a series of questions that assess a person’s understanding of various aspects of UX design, including user research, information architecture, usability testing, prototyping, and visual design. The assessment helps to determine a person’s level of expertise in UX design and identify areas where they may need further development.


For employees, taking a User Experience Design assessment can be a valuable way to assess their skills and knowledge in this field. It can help them to identify areas where they may need further development, as well as areas where they excel. By taking the assessment, employees can gain a better understanding of their strengths and weaknesses in UX design and work to improve their skills where necessary.


For companies, conducting User Experience Design assessments for their employees can be an effective way to evaluate their workforce’s skills and knowledge in this field. It helps companies to identify areas where their employees may need further training or development and make decisions about how to allocate resources to improve their team’s overall expertise in UX design. By investing in their employees’ skills and knowledge in UX design, companies can improve the quality of their products and services, leading to better customer satisfaction and increased profits.


User Experience Design is a valuable and in-demand skill set in today’s job market. Companies across industries are recognizing the importance of UX design in creating successful products and services that meet the needs of their users. As a result, there is a growing need for individuals with expertise in UX design.


Building a career in UX design begins with a solid understanding of the foundational principles and skills in this field. A User Experience Design assessment can help individuals to evaluate their skills and knowledge and identify areas where they need further development. By continually developing their skills in UX design, individuals can become more valuable to employers and increase their opportunities for career advancement.


In addition to technical skills, successful UX designers must also possess strong communication and collaboration skills. They must be able to work effectively with cross-functional teams, including product managers, engineers, and stakeholders, to ensure that the design meets the needs of all stakeholders. They must also be able to communicate their design decisions effectively, both verbally and visually, to stakeholders who may not have a background in UX design.


User Experience Design assessment is a valuable tool for both employees and companies. It cans help individuals to evaluate their skills and knowledge in this field and identify areas where they need further development, as well as help companies to evaluate their workforce’s skills and knowledge in UX design and make decisions about how to allocate resources to improve their team’s expertise in this field. By investing in their skills and knowledge in UX design, individuals can build successful careers in this growing field, while companies can create successful products and services that meet the needs of their users.

courseDetails.shortDescription: Practice mcqs for OB/GYN Doctor,obstetrician/gynecologist,Medical Students,Bachelor of Medicine, Bachelor of Surgery,GYN
courseDetails.longDescription:
What is gynecology and obstetrics?

Gynecology and obstetrics are studies of the female reproductive system.

Read on to find out more.

What’s the difference between gynecology and obstetrics?

Gynecology normally means treating women who aren’t pregnant, while obstetrics deals with pregnant women and their unborn children, but there are lots of crossover between the two. For example, women may be referred to gynaecologists in the earlier stages of pregnancy, and obstetricians later in their term.

What do gynecologists and obstetricians do?

Gynaecologists and obstetricians use a range of surgical and medical procedures. Gynaecological procedures include:

  • Laparoscopy: the diagnosis and removal of cysts and infections from the ovaries and fallopian tubes

  • Cone biopsies: the removal unhealthy cells from the cervix to prevent cervical cancer

  • Hysterectomies: the removal of a woman’s uterus

Gynecologists are also involved in smear testing programs, which are designed to detect cervical cancer and are free on the NHS to women over the age of 25.

Obstetric procedures include:

  • Caesarean (or C) section: surgically cutting a baby out from its mother’s womb to avoid problems during labor

  • Cervical sutures: using tape to strengthen a woman’s cervix to prevent miscarriages

  • External cephalic version (ECV): turning the baby around in the womb so it is in the correct position for birth

Obstetricians also test fetuses for symptoms of conditions like Down’s Syndrome using ultrasound and techniques like chorionic villus sampling.

Gynecologists and obstetricians often work closely with midwives, nurses and other medical specialists such as urologists, who treat bladder problems, and endocrinologists, who deal with hormone production.

courseDetails.shortDescription: 06 Mock Tests with latest alignment PMBOK 7th -  PMI CAPM
courseDetails.longDescription:
The PMI CAPM (Certified Associate in Project Management) certification is a globally recognized credential in the field of project management. It is designed for individuals who have less project management experience or are looking to enter the field as a project team member or project coordinator.

Here are some key points about the PMI CAPM certification:

  1. Eligibility: To be eligible for the CAPM certification, you need to have a secondary degree (high school diploma or equivalent) and either 1,500 hours of project experience or 23 hours of formal project management education. The education requirement can be fulfilled through PMI's Registered Education Providers (R.E.P.s) or other recognized training organizations.

  2. Exam Format: The CAPM certification exam consists of 150 multiple-choice questions, and you have three hours to complete it. The exam covers project management fundamentals, including areas such as project scope, time, cost, quality, risk, communications, and more.

  3. CAPM Exam Content Outline: PMI provides a detailed Exam Content Outline that specifies the knowledge areas and percentage of questions from each area. It is recommended to study and prepare for the exam based on this outline.

  4. CAPM Exam Preparation: PMI offers various resources to help candidates prepare for the CAPM exam, including the CAPM Handbook, online courses, practice exams, study guides, and reference materials. Additionally, there are many third-party study materials and resources available.

  5. Certification Validity: Once you pass the CAPM exam, your certification is valid for five years. To maintain your CAPM certification, you need to earn 15 Professional Development Units (PDUs) per three-year cycle, which demonstrates your commitment to continuing education in project management.

Obtaining the PMI CAPM certification demonstrates your understanding of project management concepts and principles. It can enhance your career prospects and open doors to entry-level project management positions.


Our practice exams are designed to help candidates prepare for the actual certification exam. A mock exam consists of questions and answers that are similar in style, format, and difficulty level to those found in the real certification exam.

courseDetails.title: Mastering Google Apigee API Management Essentials

courseDetails.longDescription:
Welcome to our comprehensive course, "Mastering Google Apigee API Management Essentials."

This program is meticulously crafted to provide you with an in-depth understanding and practical expertise in leveraging the power of Google Apigee for effective API management.

Google Apigee is an API (Application Programming Interface) management platform that facilitates the creation, management, and analysis of APIs. APIs are essential for enabling communication and data exchange between different software applications. Apigee provides a comprehensive set of tools and services to help organizations design, deploy, secure, and scale APIs effectively.

In this course, we will embark on a journey through the intricacies of API management, beginning with an introduction to the significance of API management and an in-depth exploration of the Google Apigee platform. You'll learn how to set up your Apigee account and navigate the platform interface, gaining insights into its components and architecture.

Building on this foundation, we delve into API design fundamentals, exploring the art of designing RESTful APIs with Google Apigee. We'll cover essential topics such as API versioning and documentation to ensure you have a solid grasp of designing robust and scalable APIs.

Security is a paramount concern in the realm of APIs, and this course equips you with the knowledge to implement robust security measures. From understanding the basics of API security to hands-on experiences with authentication, authorization, and OAuth 2.0 implementation in Apigee, you'll be well-versed in securing your APIs.

Efficient traffic management and insightful analytics are crucial components of successful API management. We'll explore API traffic management strategies, delve into rate limiting and quotas in Apigee, and equip you with the skills to monitor and analyze API performance effectively.

Understanding the entire API lifecycle is essential for sustained success. This section covers the overview of the API lifecycle, discusses versioning, deprecation, and emphasizes the importance of rigorous testing and quality assurance in Apigee.

As you progress, we'll explore advanced features of Google Apigee, including custom policies, extensions, and advanced API proxy configurations. You'll also discover how to seamlessly integrate Apigee with Google Cloud Services for enhanced functionality.

Learn industry best practices for Apigee development and gain the skills to troubleshoot common issues. Real-world case studies will further reinforce your understanding of implementing Apigee in practical scenarios.

The course concludes with a forward-looking perspective, exploring emerging trends in API management, the intersection of serverless and microservices with Apigee, and the pivotal role APIs play in digital transformation.

Google Apigee plays a crucial role in helping organizations unlock the full potential of their APIs, ensuring secure, scalable, and well-managed API ecosystems. It is widely used by businesses to streamline their API development and management processes.

Join us in this transformative learning experience as we recap key concepts, solidify your mastery of Google Apigee, and prepare you for the future of API management.

Whether you're a developer, architect, or API enthusiast, this course is your gateway to becoming an API management expert.
